abstract: Profits at Exxon Mobil fell by 22 percent from last year’s second quarter and by 13 percent at Royal Dutch Shell, but industry analysts remained optimistic.
snippet: Profits at Exxon Mobil fell by 22 percent from last year’s second quarter and by 13 percent at Royal Dutch Shell, but industry analysts remained optimistic.
lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Exxon Mobil and Royal Dutch Shell, the biggest oil companies in North America and Europe, reported disappointing earnings on Thursday, attributing the results largely to lower global energy prices resulting from weakening economies.

headline.main: For Exxon Mobil and Shell, Earnings Fall With Energy Prices
headline.print_headline: For Exxon Mobil and Shell, Earnings Fall With Energy Prices

byline.original: By Clifford Krauss and Stanley Reed
